decks.notes: This deck focuses on control strategies, particularly using the Dimir color combination. It utilizes the companion, Lurrus of the Dream-Den, as its central element. The main deck contains a mix of counterspells, card draw, search, and disruption. Notable cards include Force of Will, Mana Drain, and Ancestral Recall for defense and card advantage. Additionally, it includes artifact acceleration such as Moxen and Sol Ring. The deck also features land disruption through cards like Strip Mine and Wasteland. Ultimately, the deck aims to control the game by countering opponents' spells, disrupting their resources, and maintaining card advantage.

This deck is focused on utilizing the Companion card, Lurrus of the Dream-Den, which allows the player to continuously bring back low-cost permanents from their graveyard. The key strategy is to play aggressively, constantly pressuring the opponent with strong creatures and disrupting their game plan with counterspells and hand disruption. The deck includes powerful cards such as Ancestral Recall and Time Walk for card advantage and extra turns, as well as Moxes and Black Lotus for fast mana acceleration. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a strong and consistent board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using various control tools and cards. It includes a variety of powerful artifacts like Moxes, Mana Vault, and Black Lotus to quickly generate mana. The deck also features powerful card draw and tutor spells such as Ancestral Recall, Demonic Tutor, and Vampiric Tutor to find and use key cards. It utilizes counter spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's plays, while also using cards like Pithing Needle and Nihil Spellbomb to disrupt specific strategies. Overall, the deck aims to maintain control of the game and outmaneuver the opponent using a combination of strong artifacts, card advantage, and disruption.

This deck is focused on a combination of cards that allow for a game-ending play using the Doomsday card. The deck includes a mix of powerful card draw, deck manipulation, and counterspells to control the game until the combo can be executed. The key concept revolves around setting up an optimal sequence of cards using Doomsday and then utilizing Thassa's Oracle to win the game by ensuring there are no cards left in the library. The deck also includes various tutor cards and efficient spells to increase consistency and speed.

This vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on the combo strategy of utilizing Underworld Breach to generate value and enable powerful plays. The deck includes a range of powerful cards, such as Mox Pearl, Mox Sapphire, Black Lotus, and Ancestral Recall, to accelerate mana and card draw. The deck also features disruption elements, like Force of Will and Flusterstorm, to counter opposing plays. Lurrus of the Dream-Den is included as the companion, further enhancing the deck's consistency and resilience. The deck aims to assemble the necessary pieces and execute a game-winning combo using Underworld Breach.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions and resources while maintaining card advantage. It utilizes a combination of counterspells, card draw, and tutor effects to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and recursion. The deck also incorporates artifact acceleration and uses powerful artifact cards like Time Vault, Black Lotus, and Moxen to generate mana and gain an advantage. Overall, the key concept revolves around leveraging control elements and artifacts to dominate the game.

This deck revolves around the interaction between the cards Oath of Druids and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The goal is to use Oath of Druids to put powerful creatures into play from the library while controlling the game through counterspells and disruptive spells like Force of Will. Show and Tell and Tinker can also be used to cheat out powerful artifacts or creatures. The deck also includes card draw and library manipulation through Brainstorm, Sensei's Divining Top, and Gitaxian Probe. Lastly, it incorporates the powerful planeswalkers Narset, Parter of Veils and Oko, Thief of Crowns for additional control and disruption.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck is an Aggro-Hatebear archetype that focuses on disrupting the opponent while applying aggressive pressure. The key concept revolves around using cards like Chancellor of the Annex, Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, and Archon of Emeria to hinder the opponent's plays and slow them down. Additionally, the deck includes hate cards like Trinisphere and Wasteland to further disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck also includes powerful creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Seasoned Dungeoneer to apply consistent damage and maintain card advantage.

This deck focuses on using artifacts to disrupt the opponent's game plan and slow down their actions. It aims to have a strong early game by playing powerful artifacts like Mox Jet, Black Lotus, and Mox Sapphire. The deck also includes cards like Sphere of Resistance, Trinisphere, and Null Rod to increase the cost of the opponent's spells and limit their options. Additionally, it has cards like Karakas, Crucible of Worlds, and Strip Mine to disrupt the opponent's lands. Overall, the key concept is to control the game and hinder the opponent's strategy through artifact disruption.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game using planeswalkers and powerful counterspells, while also utilizing card draw and filtering effects to maintain card advantage. The deck includes a mix of powerful control cards such as Ancestral Recall, counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm, and disruptive cards like Blood Moon and Wasteland. The planeswalkers, especially Narset, Parter of Veils and Dack Fayden, provide additional card advantage and control options. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gradually gaining control of the game and ultimately winning through card advantage and efficient removal.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck is an Aggro - Hatebear archetype. The key concept revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan while maintaining a fast and aggressive strategy. It utilizes cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down the opponent's spells and taxing their resources. The deck also includes hate cards such as Trinisphere and Wasteland to further disrupt the opponent. The deck aims to apply early pressure with creatures like Archon of Emeria and White Plume Adventurer, while using the disruptive elements to control the game and protect its own threats.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck revolves around the concept of utilizing the Dredge mechanic to rapidly fill the graveyard with creatures. It includes cards like Ichorid, Stinkweed Imp, and Golgari Thug to facilitate this. The deck combines this graveyard synergy with combo elements, using cards like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam to quickly generate a board presence. It also includes disruption with cards like Force of Will and Mental Misstep to protect the combo and disrupt opponents. The deck aims to win the game by overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of creatures from the graveyard.
